content.text: Electronic spreadsheets consist of multiples of rows and columns based on the model of square ruled books. They are used to perform simple and complex calculations accurately and efficiently.
Start path for Microsoft Office Excel 2010: Start -> Programs -> Microsoft Office -> Microsoft Office Excel 2010

content.title: Worksheet
content.content: A worksheet is made up of a multitude of cells made by columns and rows on a two dimensional plane.

content.description: Each row of a worksheet is assigned a row number as 1,2,3,4,5... etc.

content.title: Table of rows and columns counts
Active Cell
content.content: It is needed to select the cell before entering data in it. A currently selected cell is called an active cell. An active cell always has a thick border.

content.title: Cell Address
content.content: A cell address is denoted first by the column letter and secondly by the row number. The address of the active cell is displayed in the name box. E.g., A cell at D column and 3rd row would be named D3.

content.text: A block of adjacent cells in a worksheet which is highlighted or selected is called a range of cells.
Range of cells in a column (B2:B5). The range starts in B2 and ending in B5.
Range of cells in a row (A3:C3). The range consists of A3, B3, C3.
Range of cells spanning several rows and columns (B2:C4).

properties: Leading zero in phone numbers is not displayed automatically in numeric format.

properties: By default value is right aligned.

content.text: A cell address (reference) consists of the column letter and the row number. In a formula such a cell address is always called as a relative reference.

content.name: Relative cell reference
content.desc: If the row number and the column letter of adjacent cells change accordingly when a formula is copied, such cell addresses are called relative cell reference.
content.example: Formula = A1+B1. When dragged down column C and sideways along row 1, cell references change accordingly (A2+B2, A3+B3, etc.).

content.name: Absolute cell reference
content.desc: If the row number of the cells remain unchanged when a formula is dragged sideways along a row, it is called row absolute cell reference.
content.example: Formula = $A1 + B$1. When dragged, only column letters change relatively while row numbers remain unchanged.

content.title: Calculating price of pencils
content.scenario: Length/Qty in A2, Unit Price in B2.
content.formula: =A2*B$2. A2 changes relatively, B2 is absolute.

content.title: Calculating price of books
content.scenario: Quantity in C5..C10, Price per dozen in C1.
content.formula: =(C5..C10)*$C$1. C5..C10 changes relatively, C1 is absolute.

sections.title: Summary
content: A worksheet is composed of vertical columns and horizontal rows in a two dimensional plane.
Columns in a worksheet are named with English letters or combination of English letters.
Rows in a worksheet are named with numbers.
Cells are named firstly by column letter and secondly by row number.
Cell content is either a label, value or formulae.
A formulae is initiated with equals sign (=).
There is a precedence of operators.
Formulas are made with cell addresses, operators and functions.
Formatting tools are used to format labels and values.
The fill handle is used to copy formulae.
Dollar sign ($) is used to make absolute cell reference.
Several chart types are available in spreadsheet applications.
